data.title: 3 Vanguard ETFs Surging While the S&P 500 Struggles
data.description:
Market volatility has defined 2026 so far, with shifting interest-rate expectations, geopolitical tensions, and uneven earnings driving swings across the broader market. While the S&P 500 (SPX) has posted a modest 1.47% year-to-date gain, some ETFs are quietly outperforming. Using TipRanks' Best Vanguard ETFs tool, we identified Vanguard Value ETF (VTV), Vanguard Mega Cap Value ETF (MGV), and Vanguard High Dividend Yield Index ETF (VYM) — each up more than 7% so far this year.

data.title: WBD Earnings: Warner Bros Discovery Stock Slides as Q4 EPS Misses Estimates & Revenue Drops
data.description:
Warner Bros Discovery (WBD) stock saw a slight gain on Thursday following the release of the entertainment company's Q4 2025 earnings report. The company reported diluted earnings per share of -10 cents, which missed Wall Street's estimate of -5 cents for the quarter. However, it was an improvement from the -20 cents per share reported in the fourth quarter of 2024.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Warner Bros Discovery's revenue for Q4 2025 came in at $9.46 billion, which surpassed analysts' estimate of $9.3 billion. Even so, the company's revenue was down 6% year-over-year from $10.03 billion. The company's revenue drop came from a 3% decrease in distribution revenue, a 7% drop in advertising revenue, a 9% decline in content revenue, and a 17% fall in other revenue.
data.author: William White

data.title: Petrobras (PBR) Is the Best-Performing Oil Co., But Its Still a Risky Pick
data.description:
Petróleo Brasileiro S.A. (PBR), better known as Petrobras, has been among the highest dividend yielders in the global energy sector in recent years. Petrobras explores for, produces, and sells oil and gas in Brazil and internationally. Despite its impressive income profile, its stock remained under pressure for much of the past two years. Early 2026 has marked a shift, with the ADR rebounding nearly 40% over the last three months amid firmer Brent oil prices and FX tailwinds.

data.title: Nvidia's (NVDA) Blowout Q4 Fails to Charm Investors — Here's What Crowd Wisdom Shows
data.description:
American chipmaker Nvidia (NVDA) delivered yet another knockout quarter to close fiscal 2026. However, its shares are only up about 1% early Thursday, even as TipRanks' Crowd Wisdom tool shows investors are approaching the stock with caution.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Nvidia Surpasses Wall Street

During the three months that ended on January 25, 2026, Nvidia saw its earnings per share balloon by 82% year-over-year to $1.62, ahead of the consensus of $1.54.

Its revenue also reached $68.1 billion, up 73% year-over-year — data center revenue alone shot up 75% to $62.3 billion, showing sustained demand for the company's artificial intelligence offerings.

Analysts Hail Nvidia's Performance

Despite the lukewarm response from investors, analysts on Wall Street have started to hail the results and Nvidia's above-consensus revenue estimate of $78 billion for the fiscal 2027 first quarter.

TD Cowen's Joshua Buchalter named Nvidia his team's "top pick," noting that the California-based firm makes "the extraordinary seem ordinary."

Investors Go Bearish on Nvidia

However, TipRanks' Crowd Wisdom tool indicates that although Wall Street investors currently hold negative or very negative views on all the Magnificent 7 names, sentiment toward Nvidia stands out as very negative in the recent quarter. The AI chipmaker boasts the largest average portfolio size of 18.3%.
data.author: Solomon Oladipupo

data.title: IonQ Surges 13% Despite Insider Filings. Here Is What Investors Should Know after a Record Breaking Quarter
data.description:
IonQ (IONQ) reported yesterday strong fourth-quarter results, showcasing over $100 million in revenue for the year, becoming the first pure-play quantum stock to reach and exceed the $100 million revenue milestone. In addition, the company filed two insider reports this week, and at first glance, they may look like selling pressure. However, the details show routine moves rather than a shift in outlook.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

First, Director Robert T. Cardillo filed a Form 144 to sell 3,540 shares worth about $111,935. The filing states the shares were sold to cover tax costs tied to vested restricted stock units. As the form notes, the shares were "sold to cover tax withholding obligations in connection with the vesting of restricted stock units." In short, this is a sell-to-cover event. When stock awards vest, taxes are due, and some shares are sold to pay that bill.

Therefore, this type of sale is common and does not reflect a choice to exit a position. It is a routine step linked to the pay structure.

Meanwhile, IONQ shares rose 6.23% on Wednesday and are continuing to trend upwards in pre-market trading, already up nearly 13%.
data.author: Ran Melamed

data.title: UNI Token Soars 15% as Uniswap Votes to Turn on the Fee Switch Across Eight New Chains
data.description:
Uniswap (UNI-USD) is making a big move that has investors feeling very bullish. As of February 26, 2026, UNI token soared by 19% in the past five days, easily beating the gains made by Bitcoin (BTC-USD) and Ethereum (ETH-USD). This price jump happened because the community is voting on a plan to expand the protocol's fee switch to eight more blockchain networks.

data.title: After Strong Earnings, Nvidia (NVDA) CEO Rejects AI Software Panic as Stocks Slide
data.description:
Nvidia (NVDA) just delivered another strong quarter, yet the real story may be what Jensen Huang said about AI and software stocks.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

After the company posted fiscal fourth quarter revenue of $68.13 billion, up 73% from a year ago and above estimates of $66.21 billion, Huang used his CNBC interview to address a growing fear on Wall Street: Many investors worry that AI agents will replace enterprise software and hurt the sector.

Huang disagrees. "I think the markets got it wrong," he said. He pushed back on the idea that AI will cannibalize software firms. Instead, he argued that AI agents will use existing tools to get work done. "That's the reason why we also say agents are tool users," Huang said.

He pointed to products from Cadence Design Systems (CDNS), Synopsys (SNPS), ServiceNow (NOW), and SAP (SAP). According to Huang, these tools exist for a good reason and will remain core to business work. "These agentic AIs will be intelligent software that uses these tools on our behalf and helps us be more productive," he said.

In other words, AI may sit on top of current systems rather than replace them. Agents could log into ServiceNow, update SAP, or run models in Cadence and Synopsys just like a human would, only faster.

Meanwhile, NVDA shares rose 1.41% on Wednesday and just under 1% in pre-market trading, despite the strong results.
data.author: Ran Melamed

data.title: AI Software or AI Chips? Two ETFs Investors Are Watching After Nvidia Earnings
data.description:
After Nvidia reported better-than-expected fiscal fourth-quarter results, investors are looking for ways to stay exposed to artificial intelligence without choosing individual stocks. BlackRock's (BLK) iShares lineup offers two ways to invest in AI: chipmakers that power the technology, represented by the iShares Semiconductor ETF (SOXX), and software companies that build applications using it, represented by the iShares Expanded Tech-Software ETF (IGV). Using the TipRanks ETF Comparison Tool, we compared the two ETFs across holdings, performance, and analyst outlook.

data.title: Stock Market News Today, 2/26/26 – U.S. Stock Futures Wobble amid Market's Lukewarm Response to Nvidia's Results
data.description:
U.S. stock futures wobbled early Thursday as traders parsed chip giant Nvidia's (NVDA) Q4 results. Futures on the Nasdaq 100 (NDX), the S&P 500 (SPX), and the Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) were down 0.03%, 0.04%, and 0.15%, respectively, at 5:29 a.m. EST on February 26.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

During Wednesday's regular trading, the three major indexes closed higher as tech and software stocks rebounded from an AI-driven selloff. Oracle (ORCL) rose 1.2%, and all members of the "Magnificent Seven" closed in the green. The DJIA gained 0.6%, the Nasdaq Composite surged 1.26%, and the S&P 500 added 0.81%.

After markets closed, Nvidia posted solid Q4 FY26 results, beating on both sales and earnings expectations. Nonetheless, its shares barely moved, reflecting cautious market sentiment given the company's outsized sway over tech stocks and major indexes like the Nasdaq.

Turning toward economic reports, weekly jobless claims data will be released Thursday, followed by the January Producer Price Index (PPI) report on Friday.

On the earnings front, notable companies reporting today include CoreWeave (CRWV), D-Wave Quantum (QBTS), Block (XYZ), SoundHound AI (SOUN), Baidu (BIDU), and Dell Technologies (DELL).

Notably, the U.S. 10-year Treasury yield was up, floating near 4.05%. WTI crude oil futures were trending lower, hovering near $64.85 per barrel as of the last check. Additionally, the Gold Spot U.S. dollar price increased to nearly $5,186 per ounce on Thursday.

Elsewhere, European indexes opened higher today amid a slew of corporate earnings releases.

Asia-Pacific Markets Trade Mixed

Asia-Pacific markets traded mixed on February 26, as global traders digested Nvidia's results.

Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index dropped 1.44%. In China, the Shanghai Composite fell 0.01%, while the Shenzhen Component rose 0.47%. Meanwhile, Japan's Nikkei added 0.29%, and the Topix gained 0.97%.
data.author: Sheryl Sheth
